body_html:
Thanks for the quick reply! The following gives me Segmentation fault (core dumped)

import numpy as np
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable
import torch.distributions as dist
t_a = Variable(torch.Tensor([0.1, 0.3, 0.5])).cuda()
t_b = Variable(torch.Tensor([0.6, 0.7, 0.8])).cuda()
t_dist = dist.Gamma(t_a, t_b)
t_sample = t_dist.rsample()
print(t_sample.cpu().numpy())`

I'm running PyTorch commit 084e3a7 from 12 hours ago

body:
Thanks for the quick reply! The following gives me `Segmentation fault (core dumped)`

>import numpy as np
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable
import torch.distributions as dist
t_a = Variable(torch.Tensor([0.1, 0.3, 0.5])).cuda()
t_b = Variable(torch.Tensor([0.6, 0.7, 0.8])).cuda()
t_dist = dist.Gamma(t_a, t_b)
t_sample = t_dist.rsample()
print(t_sample.cpu().numpy())`

I'm running PyTorch commit `084e3a7` from 12 hours ago
